report_title: Online Plumbing and Electrical Supply Sales Industry Report
executive_summary: Figures have been adjusted for inflation and are presented in 2022 currency. The Online Plumbing and Electrical Supply Sales industry sells electrical wiring and cables, relays and industrial controls, plumbing fixtures, metal and plastic pipe valves and fittings over the internet to other businesses, contractors and do-it-yourself customers. The rebounding, remodeling and construction markets significantly boosted demand for industry merchandise from both consumers and professional customers alike. Additionally, many customers turned to the internet for the convenience of at-home shopping and the savings achieved by comparing prices. Over the five years to 2022, revenue has increased at an annualized rate of 4.5%, with a 0.3% incline in 2022, to an estimated $18.8 billion.

current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Analysis is expected to capture consumers' intents and price preferences, enabling companies to offer the right product at the right price.
Over the five years to 2027, industry revenue is expected to increase an annualized 3.5%, reaching an estimated $22.3 billion.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: The residential market is expected to continue growing, with the value of nonresidential construction increasing at an annualized rate of 1.8% over the next five years.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Energy-related issues are becoming important political and social agendas
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Eco-friendly and LEED (Leadership in Energy and Environmental Design)-certified buildings will require renovations and new products as aging electrical infrastructure will be replaced with solutions that facilitate energy-efficient electricity.
The development of predictive analysis is expected to help operators target consumers more personally and increase the expediency with which they shop.

industry_definition: This industry comprises e-tailers that sell plumbing and electrical supplies. Brick-and-mortar sales of plumbing and electrical supplies are not included in this industry.
key_trends: Global and domestic demand has decreased due to the coronavirus pandemic
Improvements across major construction sectors have benefited the industry
Online retailers have been competing on the basis of price, which cuts into profit
Online sellers are expected to target consumers more personally
Private spending on home improvements is expected to increase
The development of new technology has been dynamic

market_segmentation.segment_description: Residential building construction contractors are expected to account for 31.2% of industry revenue in 2022, while nonresidential construction contractors are anticipated to represent 18.4% of industry revenue.
Commercial clients are anticipated to account for 24.7% of industry revenue in 2022 and has been steady over the five-year period.
Industrial users are anticipated to account for 21.7% of revenue for the Online Plumbing and Electrical Supply Sales industry in 2022.
Nonresidential building construction contractors are anticipated to represent 18.4% of industry revenue.
In 2022, utilities companies are anticipated to account for 4.0% of industry revenue.

products_and_services.product_description: Electrical wiring and cables are anticipated to account for 24.8% of revenue for the Online Plumbing and Electrical Supply Sales industry in 2022.

products_and_services.product_or_service: Relays and Industrial Controls and Other Electrical Supplies
products_and_services.product_description: Relays and industrial controls and other electrical supply sales are expected to account for 20.3% of total industry revenue in 2022.
Plumbing fixtures are anticipated to account for 19.3% of industry revenue in 2022.
Metal pipe valves and fittings are anticipated to account for 9.8% of total industry revenue in 2022.
Plastic pipe valves and fittings are expected to represent 6.9% of industry revenue in 2022.
Other plumbing products in this segment include shower p-traps, drains and tub spouts, among others.

tier_1_suppliers: Electrical Equipment Manufacturing in the US
Wire & Cable Manufacturing in the US
tier_2_suppliers: Screw, Nut & Bolt Manufacturing in the US
Electrical Equipment Wholesaling in the US
Plumbing & Heating Supplies Wholesaling in the US
tier_1_buyers: Industrial Building Construction in the US
Commercial Building Construction in the US

demand_determinants.determinant_description: Given the Online Plumbing and Electrical Supply Sales industry's structure and reliance on the internet for sales, continued sharp increases in the share of purchases made online and the percentage of households with internet access are crucial trends for industry demand and revenue.

With respect to the industry's major markets, demand from construction-related operators or contractors depends on a variety of macroeconomic variables, including housing starts, mortgage rates, private fixed investment and business sentiment.
As mentioned, demand for remodeling crucially affects industry demand levels.
In 2020, demand from non-residential construction and industrial users is expected to decline due to spread of COVID-19 (coronavirus).

international_trade_points.trade_description: The international trade of industry-relevant products is included at the manufacturing level.
Most industry operators are domestically owned and primarily serve customers in the United States.

business_locations.location_description: The geographic distribution of the Online Plumbing and Electrical Supply Sales industry closely follows domestic population trends.
The West region is anticipated to account for 16.5% of total industry establishments in 2022.
The Mid-Atlantic region is expected to account for 14.9% of all establishments.
The Great Lakes region is expected to account for 13.4% of total industry establishments in 2022.
The Southwest region is expected to account for 13.3% of total industry establishments in 2022.
The Plains region is expected to account for 7.8% of total industry establishments in 2022.
The New England region is expected to account for 5.9% of total industry establishments in 2022.
The Rocky Mountains region is expected to account for 5.2% of total industry establishments in 2022.

regulations_points.regulation_description: Controversy currently surrounds issues over online retailers' tax status.
Another important regulation is the Federal Trade Commission's Mail, Internet or Telephone Order Merchandise rule.
In an effort to slow the spread of COVID-19 (coronavirus), many states mandated stay-at-home orders.

barriers_points.barrier_title: Need to acquire large stock of supplies
barriers_points.barrier_description: The need to acquire a large stock of plumbing and electrical supplies to initiate sales represents a barrier to entry.
Establishing stable contracts with upstream suppliers to obtain price discounts presents a barrier to entry.
Establishing online visibility through marketing and search engine optimization expenditure is necessary to compete effectively.

factors_decreased_barrier: Growth life cycle stage of the industry

basis_points.basis_description: The ability to competitively price products is the most crucial basis of competition.
Selling functional, durable products that meet client needs and providing a range of products are important bases of competition.
Investing in marketing, search engine optimization, website organization and speed are critical for online visibility and expanding market share.

concentration_points.concentration_title: Top players have limited geographic reach
concentration_points.concentration_description: Most companies do not have resources to serve large geographic areas.
Serving nationwide markets requires significant investment in infrastructure.
Industry concentration is expected to grow as companies consolidate and e-commerce penetration increases in the overall industry.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Purchases account for majority of costs
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Industry purchases account for the majority of industry costs.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Cost of purchases volatile due to COVID-19
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: In 2020, due to spread of COVID-19, cost of purchases is expected to be volatile.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: The Online Plumbing and Electrical Supply Sales industry has a low level of capital intensity.
The level of capital outlays will vary depending on the operator.

volatility_points.volatility_description: Revenue from the Online Plumbing and Electrical Supply Sales industry has exhibited moderate volatility.

volatility_points.volatility_title: Characteristics of e-commerce market enable stability
volatility_points.volatility_description: There are various characteristics of the e-commerce market that have enabled stability.

technological_change_points.technological_change_description: The Online Plumbing and Electrical Supply Sales industry has benefited from the growing penetration of online shopping.
The rapid evolution of web technologies has affected almost every aspect of the industry.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: Using software to improve logistics management
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Operators are also using software to improve their logistics.

FAQs.question: How has your businesses adapted to the growth of online sales over the past five years?
FAQs.answer: Home Depot, the largest industry company, derives the majority of its sales through in-store operations.

FAQs.question: Are your company's sales heavily dependent on the health of the US economy?
FAQs.answer: Per capita disposable income and construction trends play a role in the performance of the industry.

FAQs.question: Does your company lease equipment to reduce overhead costs?
FAQs.answer: Companies should look to make investment in warehouse equipment.

FAQs.question: Has your company explored acquisition opportunities to expand reach and reduce overhead expenses?
FAQs.answer: Traditionally brick and mortar stores are looking for e-commerce and technology startups.

FAQs.question: Have you been able to reduce wage costs by automating operations over the past five years?
FAQs.answer: Automation is hugely important in e-commerce.

FAQs.question: Does your company use point-of-sale (POS) systems to track inventory?
FAQs.answer: Operators should be aware of new POS technologies.

FAQs.question: Have any regulatory expenses significantly impacted profitability recently?
FAQs.answer: Many states have enacted e-commerce tax laws.

FAQs.question: How does your company ensure all health and safety requirements are met?
FAQs.answer: Companies should consult state and local officials.

FAQs.question: What challenges does your company face financing its ongoing operations?
FAQs.answer: Companies should look to leasing equipment.

FAQs.question: Do you have any challenges with customers paying on time?
FAQs.answer: Companies in this industry often sell to other companies.

FAQs.question: How quickly can new technology be adopted?
FAQs.answer: Given the industry's reliance on information technology.

FAQs.question: What stock control systems do you use?
FAQs.answer: To maintain margins, industry operators must effectively control product supplies.

FAQs.question: How hard is it to promote your company by word-of-mouth recommendations?
FAQs.answer: Marketing campaigns and search engine optimization have become increasingly crucial.

FAQs.question: What proportion of your demand is linked to home improvements?
FAQs.answer: Plumbing and electrical supply sales serve the remodeling market.

FAQs.question: How is your establishment affected when consumer confidence is low?
FAQs.answer: When consumers are more confident about the economy, they are likely to spend.

FAQs.question: Do you monitor trends in broadband connections?
FAQs.answer: The number of broadband connections indicates the availability of internet connectivity.
